devdoc.details: Interface of the ERC3156 FlashBorrower, as defined in https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3156[ERC-3156].

flashFee(address,uint256).details: The fee to be charged for a given loan.

params.data: Arbitrary data structure, intended to contain user-defined parameters.
params.receiver: The receiver of the tokens in the loan, and the receiver of the callback.

maxFlashLoan(address).details: The amount of currency available to be lended.

userdoc.notice: Modern and gas efficient ERC20 + EIP-2612 implementation.

devdoc.author: Solmate (https://github.com/transmissions11/solmate/blob/main/src/tokens/ERC20.sol)Modified from Uniswap (https://github.com/Uniswap/uniswap-v2-core/blob/master/contracts/UniswapV2ERC20.sol)
devdoc.details: Do not manually set balances without updating totalSupply, as the sum of all user balances must not exceed it.

userdoc.notice: Arithmetic library with operations for fixed-point numbers.
Gas optimized reentrancy protection for smart contracts.
Safe ETH and ERC20 transfer library that gracefully handles missing return values.

devdoc.author: Solmate (https://github.com/transmissions11/solmate/blob/main/src/utils/SafeTransferLib.sol)
devdoc.details: Use with caution! Some functions in this library knowingly create dirty bits at the destination of the free memory pointer.Note that none of the functions in this library check that a token has code at all! That responsibility is delegated to the caller.

flashFee(address,uint256).details: The fee to be charged for a given loan.

params.data: Arbitrary data structure, intended to contain user-defined parameters.
params.receiver: The receiver of the tokens in the loan, and the receiver of the callback.

maxFlashLoan(address).details: The amount of currency available to be lended.
